version_description:
1. Do you want to share a payment request via WhatsApp, e-mail or SMS? Now this is possible! Receiver pays you back via iDEAL.
2. We also fixed some bugs and made some improvements such as: Improved the Payment Request functionality.
In this version we fixed some bugs
In this version we fixed some bugs and made some improvements
In deze versie hebben we enkele bugs opgelost en zijn er een paar verbeteringen doorgevoerd

* Siri is here to make your banking more easy. Just enable ‘Siri’ in the settings of the app and simply say I want to 'transfer money' or 'request money’.
Log-in and confirm the payment in one go using Touch ID. Siri works only with iOS 10.
Want to use a different account? Soon it would be possible to choose the account you want to use with Siri.
* Received a payment request from an ING account? From the link now you directly go to the app. No iDEAL page in between.
* In this version we have also fixed a number of bugs and made lots of improvements.

We bring you our iMessage App. Now you can create a payment request directly from within a message. Simply enable Bankieren in the App Store of iMessage.
iMessage App works only with iOS 10.

Shared a payment request? Now you will be notified with a push notification when someone pays back.
We’re always working to improve ING Bankieren. Make sure you don’t miss anything by keeping your automatic updates turned on.

• Gain greater insight into upcoming transactions. Now you can also view your planned savings under Forecast.

Comments, suggestions or tips? Do give us your feedback via the app, Facebook, Twitter or the ING Community (community.ing.nl). Or start a chat on our website.
In this version we fixed some bugs and made some improvements.

- New design: the transfer money button has been moved to the top of the transaction overview.
- For each payment request it’s easy to see who has already paid you back. Nice and clear.

Comments, suggestions or tips? Do give us your feedback via the app, Facebook, Twitter or the ING Community (community.ing.nl). Or start a chat on our website.

In this version we fixed some bugs and made some improvements. Make sure you don’t miss anything by keeping your automatic updates turned on. Comments, suggestions or tips? Do give us your feedback via the app, Facebook, Twitter or the ING Community (community.ing.nl). Or start a chat on our website.

It’s more easy to make a request. The payment request button can be found on the upper right, at the transactions overview.
We also added salary to Forecasting.
Comments, suggestions or tips? Do give us your feedback via the app, Facebook, Twitter or the ING Community (community.ing.nl). Or start a chat on our website.

This update for the Mobile Banking App is compatible with iOS 11.

Curious about your balance? You can now ask Siri by posing one of the following questions: 'What is my balance in Bankieren?', 'How much money do I have in Bankieren?'.

Furthermore, you can set each individual debit card to Europe or World.

Comments, suggestions or tips? Do give us your feedback via the app, Facebook, Twitter or the ING Community (community.ing.nl). Or start a chat on our website.
This update for the Mobile Banking App contains several fixes and is also compatible with the latest devices.

In this version we fixed some bugs and made some improvements. iPhone X users, can now log in and confirm transactions with Face ID. Business customers can select which overview they first want to see after login – their personal or business account.

Comments, suggestions or tips? Do give us your feedback via the app, Facebook, Twitter or the ING Community (community.ing.nl). Or start a chat on our website.

In this version we fixed some bugs and made some improvements. iPhone X users, can now log in and confirm transactions with Face ID. Business customers can select which overview they first want to see after login – their personal or business account.

Comments, suggestions or tips? Do give us your feedback via the app, Facebook, Twitter or the ING Community (community.ing.nl). Or start a chat on our website.

You can now also share payment requests for your business account. Convenience for you and your clients.

For customers with an insurance of ING, you can now find this in the app as well. Good to always have your details at hand, for example in case you need to find your policy number.

We have expanded Invoices & Receipts for entrepreneurs. You can now easily swipe to previous quarters in your overview. Do you need several scans? This is possible.

We also made a change for Touch ID. If you delete a fingerprint or add another fingerprint to your device, Touch ID for the Mobile Banking App will be blocked. You can unblock this at 'Settings' in the app. After unblocking you can use Touch ID again. This change applies for Face ID as well.

Comments, suggestions or tips? Do give us your feedback via the app, Facebook, Twitter or the ING Community (community.ing.nl). Or start a chat on our website.

-Did you copy an IBAN? When you open the app we’ll prefill it for a smooth transfer!
-Additionally, this version contains some bugfixes and improvements.

Got a tip? Send us your feedback in the app, on Facebook or Twitter. Or go to ing.nl and chat with us or with our community.

Have more insight into future transactions? ‘Look ahead’ now also shows forecasted loan orders. We have added some info about facial recognition and the lowered excess from € 150 to € 50 to the terms and conditions for the Mobile Banking App.
Plus, this version includes bug fixes and other improvements.

Got a tip? Send us your feedback in the app, on Facebook or Twitter. Or go to ing.nl and chat with us or with our community.

Look ahead now calculates for you! Scroll through your expected transactions and see how your predicted balance adjusts. Convenient! And oh, what’s that up there…?

Plus, you can now arrange travel insurance - single trip or annual, and apply for an Oranje Spaarrekening, Bonusrenterekening, Spaarrekening voor UNICEF and Doelsparen in the app.

We’re always working to improve the ING Mobile Banking App. Make sure you don’t miss anything by keeping your automatic updates turned on.

Got a tip? Send us your feedback in the app, on Facebook or Twitter. Or go to ing.nl and chat with us or with our community.

In this version we fixed some bugs and made some improvements.

We’re always working to improve the ING Mobile Banking App. Make sure you don’t miss anything by keeping your automatic updates turned on.

Got a tip? Send us your feedback in the app, on Facebook or Twitter.

In deze versie hebben het ‘plus’ icoontje uit je overzicht verwijderd. Je kunt nu een spaardoel aanmaken, onder ’Producten’.
Verder hebben we wat bugs opgelost en andere dingen verbeterd.
We verbeteren de ING Mobiel Bankieren App voortdurend. Houd je automatische updates ingeschakeld, zo mis je niets.
Heb je opmerkingen, vragen of tips? Laat het ons weten via feedback in de app, Facebook, Twitter.

Version 3.16.1:
Bugfix

Version 3.16.0:
In this release we have removed the ‘plus’ icon in the overview. You can now create a savings goal, under Products.

We also fixed some bugs and made some other improvements.

We’re always working to improve the ING Mobile Banking App. Make sure you don’t miss anything by keeping your automatic updates switched on.
Got a tip? Send us your feedback in the app, on Facebook or Twitter.

- Why send 10 different payment requests when 1 could do? As of now, you can opt to let the receivers of your request indicate what they will pay you back. Especially convenient if some had appetisers and some didn’t…
- Choose your payment request description from the most commonly used suggestions.
- We found and fought some bugs.

Important: we will soon stop supporting devices with iOS 9. You can continue using the app. But if possible, we would recommend updating to iOS 10 or a later version. This will let you use the latest app features.

Tips or wishes? Let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Unfortunately, voice recognition does not work anymore, as Inge has left the app. Logging in and confirming with your voice is no longer possible.

We found and fought some bugs.

Important: we will soon stop supporting devices with iOS 9. You can continue using the app. But if possible, we would recommend updating to iOS 10 or a later version. This will let you use the latest app features.

Tips or wishes? Let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

The IBAN name check helps prevent wrong transfers. So you can be sure that you are paying the right person or the correct company. Also, you can hide your insurance, similar to other products. Click on the little eye at the top of your overview.

Important: this is the last update for devices with iOS 9. The app will continue to work. But if you want to be able to use our app’s latest features, update your device to iOS 10 or up.

The IBAN name check helps prevent wrong transfers. So you can be sure that you are paying the right person or the correct company. Also, you can hide your insurance, similar to other products. Click on the little eye at the top of your overview.

Important: this is the last update for devices with iOS 9. The app will continue to work. But if you want to be able to use our app’s latest features, update your device to iOS 10 or up.

You could already insure your car and holiday via the app. Now, this is possible for your home and contents too. When paying a payment request, the ING app stubbornly insisted on opening. We’ve changed this (after receiving some feedback): you can now also choose other bank apps.

We’re always working to improve the ING Mobile Banking App. Make sure you don’t miss anything by keeping your automatic updates turned on.

Got a tip? Send us your feedback in the app, on Facebook or Twitter.

From now on, splitting the bill is a breeze. Tap a transaction and create a payment request. Simply divide the amount by the number of people. In this version we also fixed some bugs and improved other things. We are constantly improving the ING Mobile Banking App. Do you have a comment, question or tip? Let us know via Feedback in the app, on Facebook or Twitter. Never miss an update? Switch automatic updates on in your phone settings (Settings / iTunes & App Store / Updates).

In this version we made some improvements.

We’re always working to improve the ING Mobile Banking App. Make sure you don’t miss anything by keeping your automatic updates turned on.

Got a tip? Send us your feedback in the app, on Facebook or Twitter.

- 'Calendar' in the menu is now called 'Orders'. This is where you’ll find scheduled or rejected orders.

Do you have any comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter. Never miss an update? Keep your automatic updates switched on in your phone settings.

(Un)real! If you scan the QR code for an iDEAL payment, an augmented reality animation awaits you! This works with relatively new device types.

Important: this is the last update for devices with iOS 10.0 to 10.2. The app will continue to work. But if you want to be able to use our app’s latest features, update your device to iOS 10.3 or up.

You’ll soon be used to this: we have improved the layout of the app. As of this release you will find 4 buttons at the bottom. They are shortcuts to the most important options, to quickly get you to your account overview, all your orders, payment requests and relevant ING products.

You’ll soon be used to this: we have improved the layout of the app. As of this release you will find 4 buttons at the bottom. They are shortcuts to the most important options, to quickly get you to your account overview, all your orders, payment requests and relevant ING products.

How do I switch between my personal and business accounts? This has been an often asked question that we’ve promptly resolved. The solution is to long press the settings icon in order to easily switch between your accounts. We’ll show you how to do it in the app. Thanks for your feedback!

We’re always working to improve the ING Mobile Banking App. Make sure you don’t miss anything by keeping your automatic updates turned on.

Got a tip? Send us your feedback in the app, on Facebook or Twitter.

This version makes your account overview a bit clearer. The same goes for your payment details.
We’ve refreshed the app’s design and made it more spacious – let’s call it ‘Light Mode’. Who knows, maybe a ‘Dark Mode’ will follow? We’ve seen the requests…;)
If you’ve had trouble opening the app for iDEAL payments or payment requests, iOS version 13.2 fixes this.
Do you have any comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.
Never miss an update? Switch on automatic updates. Go to your phone settings > iTunes & App Store.

Lost your debit card? You can now instantly block it in your app. Should your card pop up again, unblocking it is just as easy.

Do you have any comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Never miss an update? Switch on automatic updates. Go to your phone settings > iTunes & App Store.

We’ve made switching between your personal and business accounts simpler.

Of course, there’s nothing simpler than creating a payment request… ;) But we actually managed to make that easier as well. If you have iOS 13, you can now create a payment request using a photo of your receipt. You’ll find this super simple option under ‘Payment request’.

We’ve solved two bugs that were bugging iDEAL. One prevented the app from correctly opening on iPads. The other asked you to open the app twice when trying to use the app on your iPhone.

Important: we will soon stop supporting devices with iOS 10 and 11. You can continue using the app. But if possible, we would recommend updating to iOS 12 or a later version. This will also let you use the latest app features.

Don’t want to show your balance to just anyone? The app now helps you: keep your balance private!
When enabling this feature in your app settings, you can display your balance when it suits you. Or hide it when needed. Simply by long pressing 2 fingers on your overview. Or, like a magician, by slowly waving over your screen, from bottom to top.
Important: we will soon stop supporting devices with iOS 10 and 11. You can continue using the app. But if possible, we would recommend updating to iOS 12 or a later version. This will also let you use the latest app features.

In this version we fixed some bugs and made some improvements. The first thing you’ll notice in the next version of the app will be the revamped login screen.

Do you have any comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

The first thing you’ll notice in our new version of the app will be the revamped login screen. So don’t worry, it really is your own ING-app.

- We love to make you happy, and thanks to your feedback we can! Dark outside? From now on you can easily switch to Dark Mode (with iOS 13 or higher).
- Besides Dark Mode this update also offers Split View for the iPad. Ideal if you’re into multitasking.
- We revamped your investment overview to make it clearer. Now you only see the details that really matter.

And of course, we fixed a few bugs – best tackle those early on.

Do you have any comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

From now on you can easily see what your transactions were for. Simply tag them. Or even better: use a # to group them, like #renovation. Tap the tag and see all the transactions of that group.

Again, you can do even more with the app: like changing your number for receiving SMS codes. Go to Service, and then to Your details. Service will also lead you to all the things that you can arrange yourself in My ING. On top of that, we wiped out a few of the usual suspects – bugs.

Lost your debit card? Simply block it in the app. And if it turns out to be in your other coat, unblocking is just as easy. From now on you can arrange this, and much more, in the app: activating, requesting a new PIN, replacing your cards. Go to ‘Service’ and select ‘Your cards’.

Do you have any comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Checking your balance without logging in. Not new in the App, but it is new with a widget for iOS 14. Give it a try! Press and hold the screen. Tap the + at the top left and select the ING widget. Place it wherever you want.

Do you run iOS 14 already and do you use a default browser other than Safari? Then it might have been difficult to switch from the app to Mijn ING without having to login again. We’ve fixed that issue in this version, so it works (again) as it should!

Making it harder for scammers is the sole purpose of a longer waiting period after you’ve adjusted your limits in the app and My ING. From 15 minutes to 4 hours. No, this has nothing to do with the new app version. We just want to warn you here too: don't let a scammer fool you with a scary story and convince you to raise your limit and transfer money to another account.

In the meantime, we’ve added several improvements to this new app version (thanks to the tips you’ve sent us). For example: from now on your email address is filled in automatically when you confirm an iDEAL payment.

Want to share a tip? Let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

In this version we added a direct link to your ING Point balance and ING store. That will make shopping a lot easier.

On top of that, we've revamped the section with tips and other things that might interest you.

And in case you have a mortgage or insurance with ING, you can now view the most important details in your app too.

Any comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Grab a drink, hit the couch and open your new bank account. No branch visit, nothing. From now on, you can fix it all with your app! Just make sure you have a valid Dutch passport or ID at hand. You’ll be set in no time.

You can now download your account statements directly from the app. Go to your account overview, tap the 3 dots at the top and choose the period you need.

International transfers? You can easily start those from the app. Just tap the globe at the top when making a transfer. You will automatically continue in My ING, without logging in.

Paid a pizza in advance or bought a joint gift? From now on, you can scan your overview of payment requests even faster, thanks to the images.

Do you have any other comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Never miss an update? Switch on automatic updates. Go to your phone settings > iTunes & App Store.

Grab a drink, hit the couch and open your new bank account. No branch visit, nothing. From now on, you can fix it all with your app! Just make sure you have a valid Dutch passport or ID at hand. You’ll be set in no time.

You can now download your account statements directly from the app. Go to your account overview, tap the 3 dots at the top and choose the period you need.

International transfers? You can easily start those from the app. Just tap the globe at the top when making a transfer. You will automatically continue in My ING, without logging in.

Do you have any other comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

It’s even easier now to tag your transaction. Start typing and you will immediately see existing tags with the same initial letters. This way you can choose in a flash.

If you search for tags or other keywords you can view your expenses, earnings and the combined balance of the transactions found at the bottom.

We also fixed some bugs and made some improvements based on your feedback, like the autofill of your email address for the confirmation of iDEAL payment.

Do you have any other comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Never miss an update? Switch on automatic updates. Go to your phone settings > iTunes & App Store.

How many ING Points have you got? You can now check this per account overview. If you don’t want to see them, just hide your Points via the eye at the top.

If you have a business account, you can view and change your My ING username via the app, from this version forward.

Never miss an update? Switch on automatic downloads. Go to your device settings > App Store > App updates.

How many ING Points have you got? You can now check this per account overview. If you don’t want to see them, just hide your Points via the eye at the top.

If you have a business account, you can view and change your My ING username via the app, from this version forward.

In this version we made some improvements and as usual, fixed a few bugs. Good riddance.

Do you have any comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Never miss an update? Switch on automatic updates. Go to your phone settings > iTunes & App Store.

A search tool, clearer layout (thanks to a lot of feedback!) and no more searching for the logout button. Indeed, this version has improved settings for your banking affairs and the app itself. Hopefully you’ll get used to it quickly and find it useful.

From now on, you can also find the inbox for your business accounts in the app. So you can view the same messages on mobile as in My ING.

Do you have any comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Never miss an update? Switch on automatic updates. Go to your phone settings > iTunes & App Store.

The total of your current and savings accounts? From now on you will see that in your overview as well. If you make accounts invisible (using the eye) they don’t count.

In the new app version, you’ll no longer see your balance in the message center. Update to iOS 14 and use the new widget for your balance check!

The app says goodbye to Siri, he/she can no longer help you. Payment request in iMessage will also disappear.

Questions or tips? Let us know via the app, Facebook or Twitter.

From now on, you can manage more business account things with the app. Like downloading your annual statement or changing your number for SMS codes. Just check out ‘Service’ and you’ll see.

On top of that, we've scared off a nasty iDEAL bug.

Questions or tips? Let us know via the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Never miss an update? Switch on automatic updates. Go to your phone settings > iTunes & App Store Updates.

As usual, we fixed a few bugs. Good riddance.

Do you have other comments, questions or tips? Please let us know via feedback in the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Never miss an update? Switch on automatic downloads. Go to your device settings > App Store > App updates.

Do you have an Easy Invest account? Well, from now on, you can easily deposit or withdraw money via the app! Just take a look in your account overview. Can't miss it.

There were still some minor bugs scurrying around at e.g. payment request. They will no longer bother you in this new version.

Questions or tips? Let us know via the app, Facebook or Twitter.

Never miss an update? Switch on automatic updates. Go to your Play Store > Menu > Settings > Auto-update apps.

You can sift through your transactions better than before, filtering by time, date, amount and type of transaction.

Do you have a business account? From now on it’s real easy to see what could be of interest to you. Tap ‘Products’ below to see what ING has to offer you.
